cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northeast across Florida Big Bend, then re-emerging over the Atlantic and turning northeastward parallel to the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England waters.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Suwannee River–Mexico Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet, including Pamlico Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Surf City NC (Atlantic coast); Suwannee River to Mexico Beach FL (Gulf coast – Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, southeast Georgia, the Carolinas, and the Mid-Atlantic coast including Virginia, Maryland, Delaware, New Jersey and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (10% cumulative) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely gusts 25–35 mph Sunday into early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in upper Chesapeake Bay; minor tidal departures possible (<3 ft).
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible Sunday–Monday with localized higher amounts producing ponding on terminals and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated waves along Atlantic approaches; minor coastal flooding possible at high tide.
